oai_dc:dc.dc:title: One-pot regioselective synthesis of functionalized and fused furans from Morita-Baylis-Hillman and Rauhut-Currier adducts of nitroalkenes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANE, V
KUMAR, T
PRADHAN, S
KATIYAR, S
NAMBOOTHIRI, INN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MBH-TYPE REACTION
INTRAMOLECULAR MICHAEL ADDITION
THIOUREA-TERTIARY AMINE
PAAL-KNORR REACTION
CONJUGATED NITROALKENES
NITROALLYLIC ACETATES
CASCADE REACTIONS
DIASTEREOSELECTIVE SYNTHESIS
POLYSUBSTITUTED FURANS
ANTIMICROBIAL ACTIVITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Highly functionalized and fused furans have been synthesized via cascade reactions of Morita-Baylis-Hillman and Rauhut-Currier adducts of nitroalkenes with active methylene compounds. The reactions involving S(N)2'-intramolecular Michael addition or Michael addition-intra-molecular nucleophilic substitution take place in a regioselective manner to afford synthetically and biologically useful furans in moderate to good yields.
